I fell in love with tapas when I studied in Spain, so having a Spanish tapas restaurant in the neighborhood is such a treat!

I came on a Friday night around 8:00 with one other person. We didn't have a reservation, but were somehow seated very quickly! (Probably wouldn't be the case with large groups). We of course ordered the delicious sangria and multiple tapas. My favorites were the croquetas, papas bravas, and mussels, but I'm sure you can't go wrong with any dish.

The servers were very friendly and, based on how crowded the restaurant was, were very quick!

Zarzuela is very affordable. You can definitely plan to spend less than $30 per person. 

After coming to this neighborhood gem, you can tell why it always has a line out the door!
author: Emmy Q.

description: This place is pretty good. We were waiting for half an hour to get to sit down (actually we are lucky and usually it takes longer time. So come here early like when it's open). We ordered 5 different tapas including baked snails, crab cakes, tortillas, a cheese plate and goat cheese wrapped by eggplant. I was already full before they delivered crab cakes. We ordered flan as the dessert. All food taste very good but I don't have one that I would say amazing. Will try something else next time.
author: Luk C.

description: Excellent food, great service, lovely atmosphere... The only issue was it was very noisy, if you are older and have trouble hearing this may not be the place for you but otherwise it's fabulous!
author: Becky W.

description: Had an early thursday night dinner there a few weeks ago. Got there early around 6:30 and was shown to a perfect table. Ordered about 5 or 6 small plates all of which were outstanding. Sorry cant remember what they were but i cant imagine being disappointed with anything on the menu. Memorably, about the time we were winding the meal down the place had filled with what acted like a bar crowd and it became unbearably loud.  Nonetheless, i give it 5 stars. Go early if you want to hear your dinner companions or yourself think. Go later if you like to be around screaming younger people.
author: Noel S.

description:
Came here asked on the reviews from check please. Sadly disappointed. Everything was just okay and no worth coming back to the restaurant for. 

Croquettes - 2 stars. Not much flavor. Tasted like bar food

Tomato and goat cheese - 3.5 stars. Pretty tasty. Probably the best dish we got

Empanadas - 2.5 stars. Had much better elsewhere. Tasted fine but nothing worth ordering again

Prosciutto - 4 stars. My husband said these were really nice. Not really my thing but guess it is good if you really love it
author: Kem K.

description: Oxtail stew was delicious, great customer service, and nice atmosphere. Celebrated my birthday here and was charge $2/person for our cake that they helped cut and served, wished they didn't.
author: Khanh N.

description: A must if you're in SF. The lamb chops are the best I've had. Great wine selection. The atmosphere is a classic. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Angela G.

description:
Wonderfully friendly service + deliciously filling paella +  great atmosphere! It's a four star for the items we ordered but the other choices seemed less appealing.

For starters, the grilled mixed mushrooms were fantastically flavorful! Even though it's as simple as garlic and parsley, the mushroom flavor was fully brought out by grilling -- what a delightful choice!

The Paella Valenciana was about just right for two of us with a bc appetite after walking around for a day. Everything in it blended very well with each other. He rice is a bit soaked if you prefer the harder texture, but I like the rice to be a bit more cooked so this was awesome.

Highly recommend the chocolate sponge cake and mousse soaked in espresso and bourbon (or some other alcohol?) Was literally soaked to just the right moisture -- provides a great balance to the heavy chocolate. 

Food was better than average -- ordering the right thing in that friendly setting was what made this meal enjoyable, not  to mention our server with his always cheerful smile!
author: Ida L.

description: A cozy and comfortable place to visit. A variety of dishes to choose from that will satisfy any taste palate. You are guaranteed to enjoy each bite and take notice of the presentation. Do not overlook the desert menu it is as sweet as it can be.
author: J J.

description:
Perhaps it's unfair to write a review only 3 weeks after going to Julian Serrano's in Las Vegas.  I'd heard great things about Zarzuela and the food was really good, but not a stand-out.  I tend to get similar dishes at tapas bars so I end up comparing.  The gambas al ajillo was good - tons of garlic and olive oil, though I thought it needed salt.  The chorizo was good, but didn't seem to be Spanish chorizo.  It was still very tasty but wasn't what I was expecting.  The lamb chops with rosemary and garlic were served with mashed potatoes and was really good (that one was my favorite).  I had a rioja which was typical Spanish and exactly what I was looking for.

The location - the Russian Hill neighborhood - is great.   It's a 15-20 walk from Fisherman's Wharf, so I'd suggest anyone at the Wharf skip the tourist food there and head up the hill to this place.  Definitely worth the walk and you won't go wrong.

Side note:  I made the mistake of not doublechecking the opening time, so I arrived at 5 pm when they opened at 5:30.  There was a small line of people waiting, so the place definitely has a good reputation.
author: Marcus P.

description:
Rude manager, food pre cooked. 
Not authentic spanish food.
Expensive 
Long waiting list and no reservations
author: Sergi P.

description:
I came to this place via Yelp after seeing that it was the top return for paella in San Francisco. I drove here, spent thirty minutes trying to find parking, and by the time I got to the restaurant, was starving for some bomb paella. As exciting as the presentation and plating was, the paella served was only lackluster at best. Instead of the flavor storm that I was expecting, what I got was a rather bland dish topped mainly with mussels and flavorlesschicken bits. 

Redemption factors:
1) the tapas were pretty good
2) service was extremely friendly and "family-like", think casual banter and harmless jibes from the waiters when you don't order dessert or wine
3) atmosphere is wonderful. I'm a sucker for romantic lighting and this place has it
4) great location for after activities. swensens is across the street, bars nearby

I don't think I'll be coming back here any time soon, but it is a great place for date nights. Stick to the tapas and wine!
author: Patricia K.

description: Come with an empty stomach and a group with an open mind and enjoy great conversation over a meal bursting with flavor.  The highlights were the sangria (always get the carafe) and the grilled octopus. The biggest bang for my buck, I've had in San Fransisco.
author: Lena N.

description:
Best tapas place ever!!
I went to Spain several times, and I can assure you Zarzuela's food tastes the same as any places around Spain.

BEST: Cazuela de Queso de Cabra :P
author: François A.

description:
There were a few stars to our meal:

Oysters topped with a veggie mix were by far the best thing we ordered. Tasty and fresh.  Too bad it was the special and not on the regular menu!

Quail was perfectly cooked and fun to eat off the bone. 

Everything else was good too. Calamari was tender and not overcooked. Croquetas, fried smelt, stuffed dates and so on.  We also had the octopus which my cousin had raved about. The octopus was tender but it came out quite salty.  Overall, a good meal. 

Our Peruvian waiter was a hoot. He made us all laugh!
author: Ada C.

description:
I have been meaning to return to Zarzuela. Oh I love you so much! I brought the bf here on his bday. It was both our first time there. We knew they didn't take ressies, so we went a bit early on a Sat. evening....like 6:30pm. Lucky us! Not only did we score rock-star parking across the street, we also we seated at the last available table upon entering the restaurant. 

Our waiter was an older gentleman and he was amazing! He was charismatic and extremely friendly. First, we ordered a pitcher of sangria...a must. Second, we knew we wanted the paella. They portion and charge per person. Bf said he was feeling adventurous, so we ordered the poached octopus over potatoes. We were planning on ordering more, but the waiter said this would be enough food and that he wanted us to save room for the paella. That was a very good suggestion bc in the end, he was right! 

The octopus was so tender and delicious. The serving size was actually quite large for a tapa, but we gladly polished it off with delight. When the paella came out, it looked so beautiful...the colors and textures.....and the aroma just so wonderful! Of course, it was yummy! For two people? It was a lot! However, we were still able to finish the whole thing...damn, we're oinkers! At that point we were really full and had no room for dessert whatsoever. We weren't even able to finish our pitcher of sangria. Between the two of us, we probably drank only 3 glasses. The waiter was so kind to only charge us for two glasses instead of the pitcher. Very thoughtful and considerate. Next time, I will  try more tapas. The menu is extensive and you just have to keep going back bc you can only eat so much each time. 

Helpful hint: parking is very tough in this neighborhood. Save yourself the trouble and take a cable car. There's a stop right in front of Zarzuela.
author: Liv A.

description:
This place is okay.  they don's take reservations...but it seemed family/friends can. There were a couple tables were empty the whole time during our (more than) an hour wait. 

The service was so slow. I don't know if they don't have enough staff or whatever reason. My water had been empty for more than an hour and no one came to refill it until before they gave us a dessert menu. so SLOW!!!

They said they wouldn't take reservation. However, there was a group of "friends" in the back room (the only way to restroom). those people there didn't care about  you walk and just kept blocking you. even you said "excuse me, can i walk though" they would slowly, yes, slowly, moved. 

The food was good, I liked the the paella a la valenciana. the seafood wasn't overcooked and the rice was not under cooked. It had a floraly taste. Good. I added 1 star back for the taste of food. I also had the empanda and garlic shrimp, they were good too. 

Paella is a must. but do prepare to wait....
author: Evan L.

description:
We had a group of 9, arrived at 5:30 & they set is up in the back room. The food and drinks came constantly and consistently over the next few hours. Tapas - hot & cold, paella, sangria...  So much good food. One of the tapas were dates wrapped with pancetta - excellent but came with 4 dates so if your group is larger, better order more!  I have to say that we had two types of paella - one normal, although I am used to a more crispy dish, and one soupy.  They were good but not outstanding.
The wait staff was very friendly and they kept things rolling.   Nice evening!
author: Mare G.

description:
We had solid expectations for the food here and we were pleased to see the consistency through the different dishes we had. The service is and prices are  very good. 

The Paella Valencia was the we looked the most forward to trying. Having been Spain several times, this dish is something that we have had many times. The Seafood was plentiful and fresh. Our one criticism was that there was not enough seasoning in the dish, particularly saffron and other spices used. The lack do seasoning left the rice bland. It really lacked the flavor the dish usually has.
author: Daniel N.

description:
The place definitely has its following however for me the food was mediocre at best. We started with the mussels in lemon wine sauce and they arrived almost cold and the flavour was terrible. It's always soo disappointing when you know your cooking is better than what you're getting in a restaurant. The complimentary bread and olive oil, olives was a nice touch but it tasted like day old bread! The crab cakes were good but lacked in presentation and a nice dipping sauce would have really amped them up. Our last item was the dates with almonds wrapped in panchetta were delicious but lacked presentation and quantity. 
I enjoyed the atmosphere and the sangria.
author: Kelley W.

description:
Walked in at 6:30 on a Saturday night and waited about 40 minutes for a table of 2.  I'm generally not a huge fan of tapas, but this place was very good.  We got:
- Mushrooms sauteed in garlic sauce (4/5) - Great flavor and perfectly cooked mushrooms.
- Sauteed mussels in red wine (3/5)
- Serrano ham with bread and tomato (3/5) - Lots and lots of ham, but the flavor wasn't quite as deep as I had hoped.... probably was incorrectly expecting it to taste more like prosciutto
- Pork medallions in cheese sauce (5/5) - Perfectly cooked pork with a piece of piquillo pepper covered in a delicious cheese sauce
- Braise short ribs (4/5) - So tender the meet melts on your fork.  The mashed potatoes were good as well
author: Simon L.

description: If you're looking for ridiculously good paella and sangria, this is the place.  It really doesn't get any better than this.  The food and ambiance is so authentic to Spain, you'll surely forget that you're in SF.  As with all great things in life, expect a wait.
author: Michele L.

description: Food is disgusting, service is bad ... I don't know how people got tricked here in the first place.
author: Ying J.

description:
I came here around 7 and surprisingly, it wasn't very busy! But around 7:30, it was packed with a lot of people waiting outside. I guess my timing was right. Anyway, I came here with a friend and because I wasn't very hungry, tapas seemed perfect.

I tried 3 tapas - pork skewers, grilled mushrooms, and croquets. It was plenty for me, and they were delicious. I saved room for dessert and tried the crema catalana and arroz con leche. Both were really tasty, as well! 

Service was great! It really was like being in Spain because they don't rush you at all. The workers just want you to enjoy your meal relaxed, and they never interrupt your conversation with friends. But they were really on top of refills and clearing empty plates. They were all incredibly friendly, too.
author: Rachel H.

description: Great service, they accommodated large group.  Food was tasty, nice tapas, home made sangria, really good and reasonable wine list!  Nice casual place for a good meal.
author: A V.

description:
Tapas! Came here with a big group for dinner. This place is great. The tapas sizes are perfect for sharing. We also got an order of paella which was more than enough for 6 people to share.

Not only was everything delicious but the atmosphere is super cozy and perfect for a night out with friends. I highly recommend this place!
author: Gabrielle P.

description:
I don't usually post reviews on Yelp, but am willing to make an exception for this OUTSTANDING Spanish restaurant. I'm from Spain and haven't found a restaurant this true to the real thing anywhere in the world, and I'm serious. Enough said.

Try the pulpo and gambas al ajillo and you'll know why I'm saying this. If I could give 6 stars out of five, I would.
author: Pedro A.

description: Small, crowded and loud but the food is good.We enjoyed the crab bisque, goat cheese, mussels, and crab cakes.
author: Rebecca R.

description:
This is my go to place in the Russian Hill area. If you love tapas it feels like your in Spain . My go to dishes are the squid , albondigas,  setas and croquetas. Nice place to go a share food with friends. No reservations, which actually allows us to put our name in and go to a wine bar nearby till the table is ready.  

Excellent food, priced reasonably with a lively atmosphere .
author: steve s.

description:
Holy crap did I do that!!...yep 5 stars I did it.  And this is why
1. There are no reservations for Valentine's Day that was the only way to get into a restaurant in SF! And no special Valentine menu you're forced to eat for a crazy price!!

2. Really cute atmosphere and nice staff felt like I was in Spain

3. The guy started serenading this girl in Spanish because it was her birthday and he actually could sing! It wasn't a happy birthday song from Chevys for sure.

4. The food was AMAZING!!!! We had a group of 6 si we were able to try alot of tapas! All was good my favorites the tripe, the octopus and squid melted in your mouth!! I will not list all we ate it was like 10 plus dishes 2 carafes of sangria and it all came out to only $50 pp including tip and we were in a food coma after so cheap!!

5. Sangria was so good it would get you wasted without knowing 

6. Just go! But not on a night I want to go. Because of no reservations there is a long wait and no parking but worth it!
author: Karen T.

description: It feels like you are in Spain from the food ,atmosphere and waiter. Very busy place,we had to wait   more than about 20 minutes. Waiter was  good at what he was doing. Three of us ordered 4 appetizers and seafood paella which was amazing :) Sangria was tasty. Prices are reasonable for the quality of the food and atmosphere. I will come here again !
author: Gaukhar T.

description:
Just had dinner at Zarzuela. Tapas were great... Paella was mediocre. However- what was unacceptable - I found a raw shrimp in my sangria. Rather than an apology- the waiter explained all the ways it wasn't his fault. All the ways it wasn't possible. He did comp us the pitcher in the end- but no apology. 

Did he think I brought a raw shrimp to throw in the sangria?? 

Terrible.
author: Nilay P.

description:
Why did it take me so long to come here?

1. It's in Russian Hill and parking is a nightmare.  I didn't realize they had a valet (though they are up the street)
2. I heard the place was very popular and I don't like to wait

I am sorry that I have lived so long without experiencing the wonder of Zarzuela.  I went tonight (Saturday) with my family (from the K to the 47 and a 3 block walk up hill).  We got there 10 minutes before the place opened and there was already a crowd waiting but it was clear that there weren't enough people to fill the place up.  Our waiter was great and reminded me of my high school Spanish teacher.  

We ate just tapas.  I have always loved tapas and exposed my children to them at an early age and they found they were able to find things they liked (bandilleras and croquetas).  I was disappointed they didn't have a tinto verano so I had a sangria and it was tasty and sufficiently alcoholic.  The dates with almonds and bacon were to die for and the Jamon Serrano is the real deal, not just a plate of prosciutto like you get in other tapas places.  The cheese plate is fabulous, the Manchego some of the best I've had.  The Marzipan spongecake was yummy.  The wine soaked pear was okay, but pears are out of season now so I want to come back and try it in 6 months.  This is now my favorite tapas place in San Francisco.  

We were surprised that it took so long for the place to fill up.  By 6:30, the main dining room was packed but there was still a little room in the back.
author: John G.

description:
The only part of my meal that was memorable was their famous paella. I've tried paella at other establishments in San Francisco, and none were as good as Zarzuela's. It is a large portion, easily shareable with 2-3 other people. They do not skimp out on the seafood (my pet peeve; after all, it is a seafood dish, right?), and at the bottom of the pan, is the yummy burnt rice that I love!

We also had the empanada and octopus. Both were decent, but the real winner is the paella. 

The service was great. No frills, efficient service. I would definitely come back when I crave paella.
author: Mina K.

description: I've been here twice now. I LOVE their pitchers of sangria. Some of the best sangria in the city. The food is also good. This is a great place for groups of people. The only downside is they don't accept reservations. I suggest stopping by and putting your name on the list and either go home and wait or grab a cocktail nearby while you wait. They will also bring sangria to you if you decide to wait at the restaurant.
author: Mandy T.

description: Food was mediocre at best. The salmon I had was undercooked and had a weird texture. The bread is dry and the tapas on the menu didn't seem very exciting. Service was OK.
author: Richard A.

description:
I came in completely forgetting about the wait. Parking is horrible so drop someone off to wait while the other parks. By the time he/ she finds parking you will probably be just on the verge of getting seated ! 

I have been craving paella since my travel abroad to Granada. Many places I have found,missed  the mark (some by way far!) I was ready to give up and just opt for a Peruvian style paella, but yelp to the rescue! I found zarzuela on a local search and very glad I did so! 

Of course I ordered the paella. The seafood in it is what makes the dish IMO. So fresh and flavorful, not just bland like other mixed seafood tastes. It didn't get lost in the rice which was great. I ordered chorizo on the side just to give the dish that extra meat feel ;) I also ordered many tapas including croquette (pretty tasty) & more meat (I am indeed a meat gal!) .. The tapas were okay but the shining star definitely are the entrees. And by entree I mean paella ;) 

HINT: paella takes around 20 mins to make so remember to order it first if your stomach is fighting a hunger war with u! Because u will never win that war, haha
author: Christina R.

description:
My boyfriend took me out for dinner last night. The food and service were amazing! We had the baked goat cheese, crab cakes, and short ribs. We enjoyed coffee after dinner and took the rice pudding and chocolate cake home! 

My favorite was the goat cheese. The goat cheese was baked in a small cast iron pan surrounded by tomato sauce. The cheese and sauce paired perfectly with some bread! Crab cakes were great, full of crab and not a lot of filler. My boyfriend loved the short ribs, which were served with an onion gravy and with mashed potatoes. They were super tender and delicious. Oh and I had a glass of sangria, it was very tasty. 

We will definitely be back! We want paella next time!
author: ally b.

description:
Cute neighborhood place with incredibly friendly service and hit or miss food. 

The Digs:

Dark interior with good sound acoustics, we could hear ourselves just fine without hearing sound bleeding over from the next table. Casually dressed patrons lend to the Tuesday night restaurant vibe. 

The Food:

While I don't expect this to work its way in to my food rotation, it was pretty decent. The lightly planched Gambas were one of the best things, and the seasoned oil they came in became my dipping sauce for the other dishes. Goat cheese was excellent, but that's hard to mess up. Paella was pretty, but ultimately forgettable, same with the jamon and other dishes. 

In Summary:

Maybe getting by a little on their casual neighborhood vibe, the food is decent but ultimately forgettable.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Food is great, we have a table of seven and we were all starving so we pretty much ordered over half the tapa menu items. 
The bill came out to way over $300 including tips which was expected with the amount of food we ordered. 
The reason I didn't give 5 stars and not even 4 stars is because I felt everyone that worked there were not happy, they all had an attitude. 
I asked for water 3 times and the bus person came over and filled TWO glasses and walked away, all three times. 
One of us had a birthday and I know the waiter sings for birthdays and when I asked him, he said "I can't sing for everyone! And besides I'm not in the mood". Can you at least give me a better excuse?
Seems like the owner is there managing, he does not smile. When I waved for him, he walks away. 
So much for this restaurant. Adios.
author: Gary Y.

description: Great tapas spot, easily able to accommodate our random group of 5. We got around 6 tapas plates and the paella for 3, which was plenty for all of us. The paella was great - very well seasoned and with plenty of seafood to go around. The other bright spots were the gambas al ajillo (very flavorful with a great garlic kick) and the grilled squid (which was much more tender than what I usually get). A little on the pricier side, but definitely a great dinner spot for anyone in SF!
author: Alex H.

description:
My biggest disappointment in Russian Hill. Unfortunately everything tastes less than they should (except for the Sangria).

Zarzuela does not live up the hype and you may have liked it if you haven't been to a decent Spanish Tapas before but that's because this is actually a very creative and flavorful cuisine. Unfortunately, Zarzuela is just a mediocre example of it. 

I visited Zarzuela when I had 2 friends in town visiting from NYC last month. Knowing that my New Yorker friends love food and Spanish Tapas, I decided to take them there and have them experience my neighborhood's pretty popular Zarzuela. When we arrived on Friday, we were asked to wait for half an hour but ended up waiting 1 hour. That happens on busy days so won't judge much. However, waiting longer just to be located inside a small room right next to the restroom does not make my night any better. So, the ambience was pretty bad.

Once we are seated, we ordered the carafe of sangria. Great job there and the sangria will probably be the only reason if I ever come back. Everything else we ordered was just mediocre and you can have the same quality, if not better, in just a random Spanish restaurant in Mission for the half of the price. We ordered Paella, lamb chops, garlic shrimp, tortilla espanola, octopus, poached octopus, red peppers and flan and except for the lamp, I did not enjoy the rest. 

So, if you are craving for Spanish food and living in the area then yeah I can understand why you would come. Otherwise, there are a lot better alternatives in the city.
author: Gokhan T.

description:
Never disappointing here! Second time here and decided to have dinner with my daughter last Friday night.  They do not take reservations, but we had a short wait with other interesting guests and when we got to our table, the  staff automatically came to greet us.  We had  glasses of sangria in front of us in very quickly

The interior of the Restaurant is very comfortable, with lots of energy and conversations going on.Nice art canvases the walls, along with pictures from Spain and announcement Zarzuela, a Spanish traditional form of musical comedy. 

Our waiter was extremely mannered, nice and had a smile on his face.  He explained that the restaurant had existed for 31 years and he had been working there since it opened. He was delightful, recommended some dishes not on the menu  (Jamon Iberico), and kept coming to our table to see how everything was.

The food here is amazing! It's worth the time I spent looking for parking! :)  We had a tapas dinner; we ordered the mussel tapas,  grilled eggplant stuffed with a mild goat cheese, Jamon Iberico, that comes with toasted bread and a tomato tapenade, mushrooms, and quail  Everything had their own uniqueness of taste! The mussel were big and it tasted fresh. The sauce/broth that comes along with the mussel is excellent for dipping in those breads, so SAVE the plate to dip dip! The eggplant was not bitter and accented the goat cheese.  Insanely good! Love it here! Lastly, for the guest who ordered the paella, they enjoyed  a perfect version,  a mix of all seafood in the platter which included mussels, octopus, shrimps, scallops, and other goodies! What more can you ask for?! 

Overall one of my favorites Restaurants!! Highly recommended!
author: Elliott L.

description:
My husband and I went to Zarzuela for dinner... The food was mediocre. The worst part- the carafe of sangria we ordered had an uncooked, dead prawn in it. As prawns are literally the bottom feeders of the sea... It was like having a cockroach in your drink. It was disgusting. 

When we showed the waiter- he gave us every excuse he could think of. "The sangria is mixed far from the kitchen" ... "I poured the sangria myself" ... "Maybe when the bus boy cleared your table, it fell in" (to be clear- raw prawns are not on their menu.)

He just wouldn't admit this was his or the restaurants fault. No apology. No explanation. My husband doesn't carry around dead prawns in his pocket.

The did comp us the carafe ... But that wasn't good enough. We should have gotten a heartfelt apology.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Walked up Hyde from north point. So we were hungry. 
Started with the green salad and crab bisque salad was fresh with  light dressing. Soup was delicious again light and fresh with a great crab flavor. Then on to a large plate of garlic prawns and a small plate of short ribs. Great amount to share if you don't want to be stuffed. Everything we ordered was great. Service was good very friendly. We will go back for sure.
author: Tracy G.

description: Great tasting food that's made quickly. Waitstaff was polite and friendly. Anticipate waiting as this place is always busy.
author: Naveen N.

description: I've been there last night and it was a great time. Food is good and service mild is really good. Will go back again for sure.
author: Aunggie N.

description:
Note: This review is based solely on the vegetarian food available here so it might not apply to some people. 

We were super lucky coming to this place on a Friday evening around 7pm because everyone after us had to wait at least 30 mins for their table. Come early if you don't want to wait. 

One thing I definitely recommend here is the pitcher of sangria! It's $20 and you get around 6 glasses of sangria which I think is a great deal! 

To eat, we ordered the warm goat cheese in tomato sauce, the mushroom, the patas bravas and the veggie stew. Out of these 4 tapas, honestly nothing stood out to me. It was a cute spot for a nice date, but the food was nothing spectacular. 

I think they're probably better for their meat dishes, but I can't judge those! 

Cute little spot in Russian Hill, but not the greatest vegetarian food.
author: Malika R.

description: Outstanding food service and atmosphere. Our party of three arrived on Friday night with no reservation and discovered a menu of wonderful Spanish small plates which were all well done and perfectly served. We'll be back and strongly recommend it to anyone who likes Spanish food.
author: Suzanne C.

description:
Not awful, but definitely my least favorite tapas places I've tried in the city. Everything was under seasoned, and was two notes short of bring good.

It's pretty generic and lacks authenticity, if you're white you'll probably like it.

Try picaro in he Castro, or alegrias on Lombard.
author: Peter T.

description: Their seafood paella is to die for! Really really good. Reminds me of the real deal in the spanish balearics. The staff is well educated and seems to know exactly what you're going to ask. I really recommend this place to anyone interested in spanish food culture.
author: Andreas N.

description: Zarzuela has amazing Spanish food! It's definitely a neighborhood favorite! The service was speedy and the food is excellent. It's an authentic Spanish experience!
author: Krista M.

description: The food here is delicious. The octopus (Pulpo a la Gallega) was one of the best I have had. The atmosphere is pleasant although a little bit too noisy for me. The staff is nice. Managed to get a table on a Saturday without reservation with only about 20 minutes wait.
author: Laura N.

description: The food was amazing especially the tapas. The owner Andy was very hospitable and welcoming. I would definitely come back again.
author: Musbah S.

description:
lets just say delicious!!!

sadly took everything togo but everything and i mean everything i would order again, let me give you a breakdown of everything we tried.

5 dishes all top notch choices
lamb chops ***** - succulent, tender, juicy swimming in its own sauce
oxtail ***** - tender, fall off the bone meat deliciousness, sauce heavy/hearty, veggies in the dish close to melting 
pork loin with mash & rosemary **** heavy, flavorful swimming in all it juices adding more flavor on ever bite
paella **** portion control ha this is enuff to feed 4 people, color pops, flavor excellent, clams, mussells full size prawns
tripe **** imma fan, chewy, heavy, cooked enough so it goes down easy after 5 chews if not less, excellent pair with the paella to suck up all that juice!

food ***** - didn't eat in house but togo was excellent
price $$
service ***** friendly, helpful, answered questions i had about the food even though i was not eating in house
ambiance **** crowded, small, hella loud, slightly dark, clean intersting wall art

parking in this area SUCKS!!! add 20-30 min if ur looking to eat in

Oh I will be back!!! hahahhaa kudos to the chef and staff
author: Clarence A.

description: Like being in Spain. Excellent tapas, paella, sangria. The calamari was especially good. Good service. Rustic, family atmosphere. Reasonable prices. A great place to relax with friends and family.
author: Larry P.

description:
Parking sucks. Food is good. Service is alright. We had to ask for a lot of things like water refills, etc.

The calamari, paella and fideos were the best dishes we had. We had a big group so we ordered almost the entire menu. The paella was one of the best paellas I've ever had. 

The mango cheesecake stood out from all the desserts we had. Sangria was not strong and a bit watered down.

They don't accept reservations. Expect to wait. I had a better experience at Esperpento. The food is on par.
author: Andy W.

description: I love this place! Great food...fair prices, fair wait time. It wasn't the BEST paella I'd ever had, but it was still amazing and all the other food was pretty delicious. The host and our waiter were kind and helpful. I would come back and recommend!
author: Kathleen C.

description: This is our second time in one year and it was disappointing.  The quality of the tapas was average, and the paella (first time that I order it) was terrible.  It didn't taste like paella at all! However, the oxtail was delicious.  Once they got busy we felt rushed for the table and I wasn't even done with my sangria and they took the glass away.
author: Patricia R.

description:
Great spot!

Tried a bunch of tapas:

Croquetas
Dates
Pimientos
Mushrooms

Will be back to get the paella
author: Alec H.

description:
The food was so incredibly tasty here.
I can go on about it but, granted, it can be easy to find good food in SF. 

The SERVICE is absolutely wonderful. The host was so friendly and I was able to order a bottle of wine at the host stand while we waited. He was great. 
The hero of the night was our server, Arturo. He was ON point at every moment of the night. He didn't hover but was available the second we needed him. He provided great insight and recommendation for the wine and food menu. 
He is a genuine hospitality professional with passion for what he does and I would highly recommend this wonderful restaurant in a cute and quaint neighborhood for the quality of food and the most wonderful service.
author: Jenni R.

description:
I am disappointed. Not the tapas experience I was hoping for. We enjoyed the simple romaine salad w tuna as well as the grilled calamari w garlic aioli. But then things went downhill from there. 
The chorizo sausage seemed store bought. And greasy. Not even a good quality olive oil it was cooked in. 
I had short ribs braised in beer. It was a lot like Yankee pot roast my grandma used to make; mashed potatoes and all. 
My husband had the seafood stew. 4 shellfish, 2 prawns and some fish. The tomato base sauce was not flavorful. 
Bummer. Not like an escape to Spain like I'd hoped.
author: F J H.

description:
Really good flavours with a good selection of Tapas dishes so you can sample some of the interesting offerings. Tried goat cheese in tomato sauce=A+, mussels in white wine were good, chorizo sausage was very good and not too much spice, and the grilled Calamari was excellent!
The Sangria was light and flavourful and went perfect with our dishes. Great experience, very authentic food and good service.
author: Chris N.

description: we had a group of 6 people and waited for less than an hour on a friday night. the place had a good atmosphere and definitely not dressy. the paella was very memorable and good.
author: Jack L.

description: Love, Love, Love....  Everything was wonderful.  We will be returning.  Great food, gracious service and ambiance.
author: Diane S.

description:
How is everything so good here?! Walked in and immediately got a table for 2 on Saturday night. First impression was that I was dropped off in the middle of Spain with their beautiful decorations and ambiance. They started us off with water, bread, olive oil and olives. We then ordered a pitcher of delicious sangria with 5 tapas plates total, which was enough to make our tummies happy:

- Serrano ham with tomato spread on bread: loved that the ham was so savory and that the bread was there to balance it out with the lightness of tomatoes
- grilled squid with aioli: cooked to just the right consistency. I really dislike when it's overcooked and becomes rubbery
- anchovy dish: definitely went out of my comfort zone eating this but surprisingly it wasn't bad. Tad bit salty but eating it with bread is a great complement
- white bean soup: the biggest beans I've ever seen in my life! Haha I really enjoyed this dish because it wasn't heavy but they gave just enough to fill you up
- empanadas with chorizo: I absolutely LOVE empanadas and this one did not disappoint! Full of flavor, slight crunchiness on the outside but chewy on the inside, just how I like them

Also our server and all the other waiters were very attentive and friendly. Overall It's a sweet place for dates and/or family events at an affordable price. I highly recommend eating here!

If you're reading this, thank you for taking me here, C. Duhn! :)
author: Lillie N.

description: The food is really good here. Pancetta wrapped dates and almonds are a must try. Squid with aioli is also excellent.
author: Zu W.

description: This place never disappoints!!  The tapas are always fresh and tasty (especially love the garlic shrimp!) and the ambience is perfect.  You feel like you really are in a small romantic tapas bar in Spain only you see cable cars out the window ;-)
author: Deni I.

description: There are not enough words to describe how much I love this place. Everything, from the ambiance to the wait staff and of course the food, is phenomenal. There are no reservations but the wait is worth it. One of the best paellas we've ever had, and we've eaten our weight in paella in Spain itself. This is one of the restaurants in San Francisco where we bring our family and friends from out of town for dinner, because it's a great experience every time. Keep doing what you're doing, Zarzuela!
author: Convict T.

description:
My friend and I both agreed that the dishes here are pretty bland.  We tried the shrimp, mushrooms, potatoes, and a few other dishes.  If you go to a good tapas restaurant, you'll find that all of the dishes are very well seasoned.  I actually had to add salt to one of my dishes - it was that tasteless.

I'm confused by all of the positive reviews...We did notice that those who ate at this restaurant were a bit...older, so maybe that explains the preference for food that isn't well-seasoned.
author: Michelle C.

description: zar-zu-ela!!! makes me want to shout! this restaurant is great, truly a dining experience. From the laughter of other diners, to the waiter belting out a sweet birthday song. Perfect for birthdays, date night or girls night out. The food is incredible (The Octopus is my all time favorite!) Andy and all the staff are sure to greet you with a smile.  Try it! You wont be disappointed!
author: T. J.

description: The best Spanish/Tapas restaurant in the city hands down. Never heard of this place until my gf decided to take us for dinner. Small but cozy restaurant with a great ambiance. Host was very attentive and got us seated quickly. Started our meal with a carafe of their sangria which was delicious as well as some freshly baked bread. For tapas we got the mushrooms and sausages which were both awesome. For our main course we had to go with the Paella Valencia and it was nothing short of perfect. After spending half a year traveling throughout Spain last year I've been craving an authentic Spanish paella and this is the closest I have gotten. Cannot recommend this place enough, its worth the wait and every penny, will be back soon!
author: Josue V.

description:
Delightful little place that I happened to stumble upon. If you can make it past the crazy hilly parking, congrats, you are truly a warrior!

The atmosphere was bubbly and lively when I arrived and even though I was traveling solo, they were happy to accommodate me. There is no bar so I just sat at a regular table. The server was excellent and friendly. I am gluten free so they gave me olives instead. I had the small entree of "fish of the day" which was salmon. It was cooked perfectly and very tasty. The portion size was spot on. 

I love these smaller neighborhood-y places and recommend this place for a friendly vibe and delicious meal (big or small!).
author: Rebecca R.

description:
tucked away in charming russian hill, the food and atmosphere bring lots of people to wait in line for dinner! they don't take reservations, so come early, or late, or on a school night :P

we ordered sangria to start, which quickly dwindled, and we got more..it was a tad on the sweet side though.  of course there was cheese, paella, squid and shrimp tapas. everything was good, but a bit underwhelming to be honest, given the rave reviews.  i thought most everything could have used a bit more seasoning, and a bit more finesse in preparation.  merrggghhh. with that said, it's a cute family oriented restaurant that is a good choice for a simple tasty meal on any day.
author: Christina L.

description:
I am Spanish and foodie, and this is the best Spanish in town for me. There's some great Spanish restaurants, all good for different reasons (some for the atmosphere, some for cheaper price, some for location, some for "wannabe"...)  but all in all Zarzuela is my favorite: Best food and nicest people. The team has been together for ages, it says a lot about the bonding and care among themselves and for their clients. It is family style all along. The food tastes of Spain, not pretentious or mixed or "fusioned". The octopus is perfect Galician style, the callos bring you back to Madrid and it's hometown with the Fabada! the basics are real: delicious Croquetas, Tortilla de Patatas -as good as the one I make myself at home, and that's hard ;)  Chipirones with ali-oli, boquerones in vinegar, pisto like grandma's, etc etc... I tend to stay on the tapas rather than the larger plates because we always go in a group and we want to try it all! 
Even the desserts are great, though I'm not such a "sweet tooth" - I'd recommend the Ponche Segoviano -marzipan kind of cake, can't find it very often, typical from the native region of Lucas, one of the owners; the "brazo de gitano" and the rice pudding are also amazing. 

Plus the wine list is great and cheap! Excellent Alvariños and Godello in my favorites in a range of $40-60, and obviously a great selection of Riojas and Riveras. They also have nice Malbecs for sure. Can't get wrong. 

If there's something "negative" to add, might be that they don't take reservations! During the week, or early on a Saturday, you're fine. Later, what we do is get on the list and they have a small "waiting room", not fancy but ok to get a wine while waiting. Or we go have a drink in some of the very nice wine places around there.
author: Elena C.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city! Love the family feel and the paella is amazing. Everyone is very friendly who works there and you can order wine while you wait for your table.
author: Natalie S.

description:
For authenticity, this is the best Spanish restaurant in San Francisco.  Actually I accidently stumbled upon this restaurant when I was playing tennis a few blocks away on Lombard Street and had to go to the bathroom.  And even though I really didn't look like a restaurant patron, they were gracious enough to use their facilities (take note Clement street and Chinatown restaurants on the concept of paying it forward).  When I found out they served Spanish food, I started frequenting here a lot with my significant other who is from Valencia.

5 Stars.
author: Daniel Y.

description: Everything about this place is 5 stars: food, service, and ambience. We took bus 41 from the financial district. If you'd like an intimate atmosphere away from the tourists, come here. You won't regret!!
author: Richard S.

description:
Went here last night with friends.  The food was amazing.  I've heard San Franciscan's are liberal.....with yelp reviews.  Me?  I'm not.  I feel like I give a thoughtful star rating.  I hate it when I go to a 5 star rated restaurant and they are more like a 3.  Anyhoooo!  My favorite tapa we had was the calamari.  I could have had 5 plates of that and been totally happy.  Mushrooms were good but with so much yumminess, I would go with stuff ya can't make at home.  Eggplant with goat cheese was delicious and I don't like goat cheese.  Fig wrapped bacon was nice as well but sweet.  Like a dessert.  We had to get the paella which was good but I'm not a big fan of paella.  If you like paella, I'm sure this will be one of the best you'll have.  All in all, a great restaurant.  5 stars, I'm not sure.  

The atmosphere was casual and a bit loud.  Definitely not a place you want to come if you're looking for romantic settings.
author: Inconspicuous V.

description: Try the lamb. The lamb does not have a game flavor and it's perfectly marinated over 24-48 hours. Best lamb o have ever tried. What made our experience memorable was our server Arturo. He was honest with dish recommendations and his service impeccable! Thank you!
author: Robin S.

description: Great tapas and very nice atmosphere, it feels like you are in Spain, we got treated for a nice desert for our anniversary
author: Kal E.

description:
There was no wait on a Tuesday at 8pm and we were seated immediately. But I've seen this place on the weekends and it does get packed with lines out the door.

We started with a carafe of Sangria which was pretty good. Then we had the goat cheese with tomatoes (YUMM) and the beef shortribs (AMAZING). The paella was also very good although it did not come with a "may contain tentacles" warning which I would have appreciated. I'm also very skeptical that they cook it to order. Our rice did not have that crispy part at the bottom and it came out way too quickly. But I'm willing to overlook that, because it was tasty and I was hungry.

Our waiter was an elderly gentleman and service was charmingly rude. I didn't know that was a thing but somehow it works here. Glad I finally got around to trying this place.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Missed me some authentic Tortilla Espanola (Spanish omelette), and Zarzuela satisfied (and for only $6!!)  Also split the Bizcocho Gitano (chocolate spongecake) which was yummy.

Restaurant was a little bit noisy so it was hard to hear across the table, and waiter was a little rude.
author: Emily W.

description:
Zarzuela has a diverse menu of dishes to choose from, and they are all delicious. 

Location/Atmosphere: 4/5. It's a bit crowded inside, but has a very warm ambiance. It's not too loud and conversations are easy to hear even when the place is packed. I've gone here several times on Friday and Saturday nights and only had to wait up to ~40 minutes (no reservation!), which is pretty good. You may be seated at a community style table, but they do this in a pretty tasteful way. 

Service- 5/5. Very prompt, professional service. Zarzuela gives their patrons bread, olives, and water for the table; all of these are promptly refilled when they're emptied. The food comes quickly, and the servers keep an eye on all their tables--when you're done with something, it's quickly taken away and you're asked if you want something in addition! As I said above, I've never had to wait more than 40 minutes for a table, which is appreciated, as well.  

Food-4.5/5. Bread is great, olives are great, sangria is great. Some of the tapas are not my personal favorite, but no matter, because many of them are! All of them are excellently prepared and delicious. My one comment that you should be aware of is that regardless of what you get, it's very rich food. This isn't necessarily a negative, but just be prepared for it. 

Overall: One of my favorite spots in this neighborhood.
author: Kate T.

description: We had high hopes but we were let down. My son commented that this was the kind of place frequented by young women who spent semesters abroad in Spain and brought friends in to impress with their newly acquired authentic taste for Spanish food. "Let me order. I know exactly what to get."  Snarky, son, but spot on. The food, not so great. The Catalan seafood stew was chintzy and the fish didn't seem as fresh as it could have been. Then the waiter overcharged us for wine. Spanish restaurants outside of Spain are rarely winners. This was no exception.
author: Moe B.

description: Let me start off with saying don't be afraid to experiment! I wasn't too sure about ordering the goat cheese and tomato sauce, but it turned out to be my favorite of all the tapas we had. Everything we got was delicious and varied, definitely some of the best Spanish food I've had. The restaurant is a little cramped but it adds character. We were sat in about 10 minutes on a Friday night and our server was very attentive. Definitely going to check this place out again!
author: Christine M.

description:
I will never forget celebrating my 26th birthday here and having the whole restaurant sing happy birthday to me... and the delicious chocolate espresso roll cake that ended the night.

This little gem is romantic, great for dates and food is consistently delicious. 

When we go, we get the tortilla espanola, iberico jamon with tomato bread, the quail, lamb chops and short ribs are all good. We don't get the paella because it is just not the best thing on the menu. 

Only down side is they don't take reservations, so go early or late!
author: Amber S.

description: Best dining experience I've had in a long time. Everything from the appetizers to the service was above par. Definitely a must- when you're in SF. .
author: Ashish P.

description: My wife and I love this place.  It became our go-to date spot for Friday nights when we didn't have plans, and it never failed us in the 20+ times we dined there. The food is great, and the atmosphere and waitstaff are even better.  We're just sad that we won't be going there as frequently now because we moved from a block away to Marin!
author: Adam M.

description:
Cozy unpretentious Tapas restaurant in Russian hill. 

Went on a Friday night for dinner. This place don't take reservation and its busy all days. However call up to add your name in their waiting list and be prepared to wait for 20 mins. Note: Parking is hard, so instead take the cable car and enjoy the quaint neighborhood. 

2nd time went for a friend's birthday. We were a group of 10 people. Zarzuela accommodated us very well in the inside room which we were not aware of. Hence this is a great option for big group as well. 

Service - Very friendly staff and attentive service. 
Ambiance - Intimate and romantic. Sit by the window, sip some wine/sangria and watch the cable train pass by, just perfect way to relax! 

Food - Great! The tapas dishes we tried were all good and moderately priced ($8 - $10). They served complimentary olives and bread for table.

Definitely order a carafe of sangria ($20) for the table! Its refreshingly tasty. Serves around 6 glasses, so perfect for 1 carafe to be shared by 2.

My favorite MUST ORDER  - 
Ham and chicken croquettes - Served 6 pcs, delish and a filling appetizer.
Leg of duck - Serves 4 pcs, well herbed.
Grilled lamb chops - served with mashed potato. The meat is soft and juicy. 
Grilled squid with aioli - The squids, grilled to perfection and so creamy! 
Goat cheese in tomato sauce - Goat cheese with the tomato sauce on the bread is a great combo and my favourite.
  
Some of the just Average plates to avoid ordering:
- Deep fried anchovies
- Patatas Bravas
- Sauteed shrimp

Bill comes to around $70 for 2 people.

Next time here will have to try the much talked about paella. A definite favorite gem in my neighborhood.
author: Payal B.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in a long time. We were seated in the best corner table for two immediately after walking in, and the owner/maitre'd was warm and friendly. The decor is also quite nice, though sound carries a bit and it's a tad loud.

The menu has a ton of options to suit every pallet, though quite seafood heavy (yum). We started off with a couple of glasses of the house wine and it was quite good. 

The 4 dishes we shared:

Mussels
Mushrooms
Panchetta Wrapped dates
Roasted Muscovy duck

All were phenomenal, and it was fun eating small plates. The prices were very reasonable for San Francisco, and the place had a genuine local feel. Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly. At one point a waiter sang for one table and the entire restaurant grew quiet and applauded after. Will certainly return. 4.5 stars.
author: Jordan C.

description:
We love this place, best tapas this side of Spain. 

We were in southern Spain two years ago and fell in love with Tapas, so when we found Zarzula`s and tried it, we fell in love with them too. 

The service is great and the tapas outstanding. You won't be disappointed here.
author: Dave J.

description:
Best value, best tasting, best service, best priced wine list on nob hill.Arrived at
6;30 on a Wednesday and got seated right away. Service was spot on!! Several of
us wanted wine by the glass and others by the bottle. They brought out bottles
opened to give us tasting to help us find what we wanted. We ordered everything
on the menu and except the Piaya. Will be going back to try that. Prices are
very reasonable. The desserts are also good.
author: Peter F.

description:
Awesome service ( Andy ) the owner is so friendly and helpful. The food is authentic and delicious. We have been there for 8 years and never disappointed!! The special sermon is outstanding. It's not on the menu 
Must try!!
author: Katie E.

description:
3.5 stars. Dinner before 6pm parking was still brutal. Food was better than average, but expected a little more due to the hype. Wish service was a little bit better. BFF needed water all night long. Server passed us 5 times, but was too busy for us to stop him for water. Felt a bit rushed as well :/ hmm

Paella for the price, I expected WAY better. Flavors were not bold enough and the rice was way undercooked. Was so disappointed  on that, even the yummy squid and tripe and salty sausage didn't make up for that. Sangria was good before the ice.
author: mui d.

description:
The food just keeps coming and coming and coming!

Came here for my close friend's graduation party, we had everything served family style.  EVERYTHING was delicious. There was this dish which is goat cheese wrapped in eggplant, YUM. but the best thing of all, was desert. FROZEN MANGO CHEESE CAKE, we had to get seconds. omg. i need to go back. now. 

FYI, parking is hard! Give yourself a good 30min - hour to find decent parking.
author: Mya M.

description: Although I usually hate seafood (minus salmon and tilapia) and this places wreaked of seafood, we had a great time! Sangria is obvs a must, yes the whole craft. We opted for the second paella (with less seafood) , still had a ton but i picked my way around it and it was  delicious. The servers were great and we got to hear the owner sing happy birthday!
author: Hetal P.

description: My wife and I visited Zarzuela on a recommendation. The tapas were fantastic with exceptional service. Great job!
author: Brandon H.

description:
Knowing that this restaurant is one of Gary Danko's favorite places to eat at, I had high expectations.  Unfortunately, what blew me off was the RUDE SERVICE I received.  After getting our table, we sat there for a long 10 minutes, being ignored completely.   The restaurant is small and manageable enough for a single soul to help us.  What bothered me most was the man who was standing behind the podium in front of the kitchen.  He was unoccupied so I looked over at him and signaled for service.  He looked at me with no response and just turned his head away.  I was furious to the point where you can see fire in my eyes.  The least he could have done was bring some water over or inform us that someone will help us shortly.  POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. PERIOD!  

Aside from the heated discussion above, the food was delicious. We ordered the CRAB CAKES (loved it), MUSSELS (each shell was filled, so they did not cheap us out at all), JAMON SERRANO (thinly sliced and flavored nicely), PAELLA (good big portion, but my favorite is still from Fresca), and POTATO ONION OMELETTE (served cold..not really my thing, but still enjoyable).

Digging the tapas, but not the service! tsk tsk...
author: Therese F.

description:
Pros:
Service was great
Beautiful inside

Cons:
Food was just okay 
Parking is hard

No reservations just walked in and got a seat at 530.

Would I come back? It's hard too try this place again when there are so many other great restaurants in the city.
author: annie n.

description: We ordered the jamon serrano con pan y tomate, tortilla espanola, gambas ajillo (garlic shrimp), and the paella. My favorite dish was the paella, which was pretty large and contained a good amount of seafood. I also really enjoyed the garlic shrimp and the jamon serrano con pan y tomate, and would definitely recommend getting the carafe of sangria.
author: Cici A.

description:
I have been wanting to check out this place for some time. I finally got around to it and was disappointed.  How do you not have Estrella Damm? (and not have a suitable alternative)  How do you ruin Patatas Bravas? Tortilla was mediocre. Service was flat. 

Maybe it was an off night, but I won't be back to give it another try.
author: Brendan R.

description: One of the best places in San Francisco.  Amazing atmosphere, excellent and professional service. The seafood paella that we had was the most delicious paella in city so far.
author: Egor L.

description:
We showed up with a group of 12 at 8:15 and the owner said come on in. We ordered many different plates to share around the table and everything was amazing. We had many different dishes, but some of the best were the calamari, snails, paella, empanada, and this almonds in dates thing.

For all 12 of us it was around $200 which seemed really reasonable. I strongly suggest trying everything!
author: Alissa F.

description: Old & tired.  There are so many superior Tapas restaurants in the city, so try those instead.
author: Bill K.

description:
Awesome and authentic food and service thank you Arturo for the hospitality!

Always ordered the Octopus consistently tasty and cooked to perfection. 

Oxtail could have been more tender but it was full of flavor!
author: Carlos S.

description:
On the day of my mom's 67th birthday she looks at me says, "I have never tried Spanish food, lets go to a Spanish restaurant!.  Yay! Lets do it!   Though I have been to Canelas (awesome), Joya (awesome), Lolo (yum!), ChaChaCha (fun time), this place came up as one of the 'highest rated,."  Done!.  Lets go!  Coming from the East bay and trekking into SF on a rainy night to try something new and take mom out for her bday - was pretty excited.   

After an hour or so of driving, I drop her off at the restaurant and go to find parking.....an hour later...i'm still looking for parking....I ended up parking down past Van Ness and taking a cab back up the hill.  Though this was annoying; I don't blame the restaurant for this - Russian Hill is just like that.  Okay, so now I have to re-energize.  Sit down, the manager (I think) comes by and feels bad that it took me so long to find parking, he chats it up with me for a bit (appreciated that - thank you!), now I feel better, can I have a glass of vino!  Smiles come back!  

Ambiance: small, intimate, fun, yet cozy.  SUPER LIKE. 

Menu time - here's what we ordered: 

1) Ensalada De La Casa (salad)
2) Banderillas De Solomillo Cordero (pork tenders)
3) Champinones Plancha (mushrooms)
4) Codornices Estofada (quail) 
5) Patatas Bravas (potatoes)
6) Mango sorbet based on cheesecake, with strawberries and coconut flavorings

Of the above dinner options, my favorites were the salad and the pork tenders! Holy Yum! I could've ordered two more of those!  But, by far, the dessert was AMAZING! I feel like I could go back there just to eat that! I wanted to take the whole pie home! 

AND for the above 6 items, plus a glass of wine, the bill was super reasonable! 

I highly recommend this restaurant - just make sure you cab it :)
author: Trish S.

description:
Zarzuela came highly recommended by a colleague - so when we went there for our 32nd anniversary we went with high expectations.  Our instructions were to ask for Arturo, and tell him to serve us.  To not even look at the menu.

We arrived around 6:30 on a Thursday - early enough that we had our pick of tables so we took a window away from the door.  The place is small, probably seats about 50 at the most.  We asked for Arturo and a few minutes later he came to our table.  After introducing ourselves and letting him know our reference he assured he'd take great care of us.

And man did he.

For tapas we had little spanish pardon peppers, pan fried in oil to the point where they were blackened, to burned accompanied with what at an Italian restaurant would be a caprese salad along with spanish olives, bread and oil.

The main was lamb chops - cooked to perfection, with potatoes.

We were so stuffed that we passed on dessert - opting for espressos only.

Fabulous meal - Arturo was ever so attentive, and we loved his choices.

A definite revisit.

(Note on rating - I use 1 = while I didn't die of food poisoning I probably wish I had, 2 = I cooked a better meal when I was three and made vulcanized eggs with burnt toast for my parents' breakfast, 3 = Good food - would definitely go back, 4 = great food - highly recommended, 5 = Holy cow - I would make a trip to a different city to eat this food.)
author: Andrew N.

description:
Food: I had 2 tapas, the ham and cheese croquettes, and grilled eggplant stuffed with goat cheese. The flavors were lacking to say the least. Then finished with the dry paella. 

Service: The service was good, but they did not go above and beyond. They never came to check on the meal or anything, let alone refill our water.

Final Comment: If this is your first time having Spanish tapas/food, you might be amazed. However, I've traveled through Spain, so I have a pretty good idea what GOOD tapas and restaurant Spanish food tastes like, and the food they serve here is nothing phenomenal. It's definitely not gourmet in my book.
author: Ray C.

description:
Went here with a friend for dinner on a Wednesday and although they don't take reservations and the place was already pretty busy, we were able to get seated right away right by the front window. The restaurant itself is one big brightly lit room with high ceilings, and is good for both intimate and group settings.

We tried a number of items, including the braised short ribs, sauté shrimp and grilled mixed mushrooms with garlic and parsley, all which were delicious. We also ordered the grilled squid with aioli. I wasn't really thinking when I ordered it and had thought it was going to be a lot like calamari, but it was (obviously) pieces of grilled squid placed on top of aioli. The squid was perfectly grilled and went well with the aioli, and was surprisingly my most favorite dish of the night. 

Service was very friendly but not overbearing, and our waters were always filled. We also ordered wine, and their pours were very generous! 

Parking can get difficult in this area, so leave ample time to find parking or take public transportation.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: I'd rather have my name atop my local newspaper's obituaries than on the waiting list of this restaurant.
author: Benjamin D.

description: Great food, great service, great venue. The beer is $4 which is awesome for the city and all the food tastes like your beloved family member cooked it. Took me back to the five years I spent Sevilla. Run, don't walk to Zarzuela.
author: Ana M.

description: We are in town visiting San Francisco for the first time and was referred to this restaurant. It is a very nice and quaint Spanish restaurant. The ambiance and food  presentation was very nice. We didn't care for the food that much. The grilled shrimp in garlic and oil was really delicious. Neither of us liked the croquetas, the fried goat cheese, or the egg plant dish at all, but it was very affordable.
author: Nichole G.

description: I'm so glad all the other Spanish restaurants were booked tonight, because we landed here! We had an amazing time,  delicious food and great service!!! We will definitely be back when craving Spanish food again.
author: Laura M.

description:
This is by far one of my favorite spots to go to in the city.

Careful though, parking is a pain. The mister spent over 30 minutes finding parking--I suggest you have the passenger get out and write your name down. Wait time could go anywhere from 45 mins to 1.5 hours. It's well worth it. So have a person wait while the driver finds parking. 

You'll see that the wait can be long to just stand there so leave your number to have the owner call you when your table is almost ready and peruse the streets. I like the collectible antique shop next door. Or make your way to the market across the street to kill time. If you prefer to sit outside and chat, the owner will take your drink orders so you have something to sip on while you wait. Also, there's a waiting room in between the main dining room and side dining room (to the left) in case it's a cold night. 

The ambience/atmosphere is kind of what you'd expect in a.. match.com commercial. Hahaha! That's the best way I can describe it. Busy, loud, fun, but somehow intimate at the same time. The lighting makes your date easy on the eyes, y'know what I'm saying.. ;)

I find that their service is very fast. Highly recommend getting the carafe of sangria ($20), you'll  get about 6-8 glasses. Good for two people to share... 0=)

After ordering you'll get a loaf of bread, some AMAZING olive oil (I've had a handful of olive oils, but the olive oil they serve here is very rich and flavorful!) and a mini plate of olives. Love it. Try not to eat too much of the bread, it should be enjoyed with your tapas items and/or in between or tapas items.. Or, I suppose you can order more bread.

The first time I came here, we ordered the paella. It is VERY filling for two.. So either have a big appetite. If I came as a party of 4, it would be perfect to order along with 1 cold and 1 hot item. .. Just giving you an idea. The rice is not soggy, I'd say it's almost like the al dente version of pasta. They give you PLENTY of seafood. All for about $16--

This time around, as much as I wanted paella, I really wanted to go big on their tapas. 

We ordered, I'll try to add the prices of what I remember:
- COLD Tortilla Espanola (potato onion omelette) ($6) - I would skip on this, it's GOOD, but it's a waste of stomach space for some better items. It's very dense and tastes exactly like what you'd expect, cold potato and onion wedges. It came with a cold mixture of citrus tomatoes and onions which was a nice balance to the density of the dish.
- COLD Plato De Queso Variado (Cheese Platter) ($11) - The cheese platter was great, all except for.. I want to say it's like a Tallegio cheese, it's not so much stinky, but it tastes SO strong. Like, imagine the strongest cheese, with a kick in your mouth, but not the good kind. It's definitely more for major cheese connoisseurs. No apple, candied walnut, grape or sangria could wash that awful taste. It's not for me.. However, the rest of the plate had GREAT cheeses, 3 other kinds with some red grapes, candied walnuts and green apple to complement the flavors of the cheese. I'd definitely get this again, but avoid the veiny one in the center. 
- HOT Champinones al Ajillo (mushrooms in garlic sauce) ($8) - I love this. I ordered this the first time here and this last time and I'll continue ordering this. It has great flavor and you can really taste the garlic.
- HOT Calamares A La Plancha Con Aioli (grilled squid with aioli) (9) - My favorite item of the night. The aioli is killer.. I just wanted to dip everything in that aioili. The squid was grilled perfectly where it isn't chewy or tough. It was moist and tender. Perfect combination. Well done Zarzuela. This was a beautiful dish.
- HOT Mejillones Al Azafran (Mussels sauteed in white wine, garlic and saffron) ($9) - Another one of my favorites! It came with a lot of mussels, cooked perfect. You ever get mussels where they've been steamed for too long and you wonder where the rest of it went? Well, that won't happen here. It was great. The white wine with garlic and saffron was a great way to enjoy the mussels.
- HOT Patatas Bravas (fried potatoes with spiced tomato sauce ($7) - This was good, the sauce is very spicy which I liked, but we were so full. Again, I probably won't order this again. It was good, but a waste of stomach space for better stuff!
- HOT ENTREE Costillas Breseadas A La Cerveza (short ribs braised in beer) (Small - $13) - It was okay. It came with mashed potatoes. I think by then we were so full from the damn potato onion omelette at the beginning of the meal that it ruined what could've been another amazing item. It was full of flavor.

Everything including drinks tax and tip came out to just under $100. Be generous tippers. Tip them well, because they give great service. 

I will keep this place forever in my heart, still one of my faves in the city. Sk
author: Zo T.

description:
Favorite Spanish restaurant in the U.S. thus far!

I came here on a late weeknight and the place was packed.  I guess everyone was eating on Spain time.  

After a small wait, we were seated and ordered paella, a Spanish omelet, and croquettes.  I wasn't a huge fan of the omelet, but that might be more of a product of personal taste as opposed to the quality of food.   The paella and croquettes were very tasty.  The waiters were very friendly and I loved the overall ambiance.  

Wish they took reservations, as it's a bit risky to drive up all the way from the Peninsula without a guaranteed table.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Wow, I have heard great things about this place, and when I walked there to meet a friend of mine for dinner I thought about how many times I had passed that intersection but didn't really notice Zarzuela before.  Well, now it is definitely on my short list of great restaurants in the Nob Hill/Russian Hill area.

The mussels and jamon serrano were really tasty, and the sangria was really good, too.  We weren't rushed at all during our meal, and the restaurant was very busy without feeling crowded, and there was lots of birthday singing this evening. :-)

All in all, I really enjoyed the experience, and am looking forward to coming back to try more tapas and enjoy more of the excellent sangria!
author: Mel G.

description:
I got to the restaurant at 845 pm. I was told to come back at 915.  I returned at 915 pm and was told not to leave.  I figured I was going to get a table soon. This was not the case. We were not seated until another 30 min later. 

I ordered the octopus with potatoes but the waiter told me they were out. This was the dish I came here for. As a result, I order the grilled squid. We also ordered the Lamb chop with mash potato, shashito peppers,grills dates wrapped in almond and pancetta. The dates were delicious. The squid was over priced. The peppers were ok. 

This place is over rated. Also parking is terrible
author: Frank A.

description: Paella served in a pan!!!  It was quite filling.  Tapas were ok.  Squid one was the best.  Small place.  Kind of pricey.  Street parking so we took BART then carpooled
author: J W.

description: This place is definitely one of the top places I've been to in San Francisco! I visited Barcelona in the summer and was thrilled that there was a Spanish restaurant not too far off from my house. My friends and I waited about 20-30 minutes and the food was amazing!! I loved everything that we ordered from the paella a la valencia to the crema catalana and sangria. Definitely ask for the jamon iberico as it is not on the menu but be prepared to pay more for this as it is a special ham from spain ($28). The place can be a little bit on the pricier side, but it's well worth the price for the quality and taste. The staff was really friendly and welcoming and the overall experience was just really pleasant. The food tasted very authentic and was reminiscent of my time in Barcelona!
author: C H.

description:
My wife and I were staying on Van Ness for vacation, and Zarzuela was the best reviewed place within six blocks of our hotel, so we tried that for dinner on our first evening here after a rough travel day.

The dining room is small - probably ten tables or so.  We had about a twenty minute wait to be seated on a Thursday evening, totally understandable given the time (7pm).

We ordered the paella, and it was fantastic.  It is only made for groups of two or more (and we had a third serving leftover). 

We would absolutely go back.
author: Todd S.

description:
We had a decent meal here, probably more of a 3.5 stars but found enough misses along with the hits not to give a higher rating.

We ordered a large number of things from the fried smelt, anchovies, serrano ham with bread and tomato spread, traditional crab bisque, braised short ribs, sauteed mushrooms, and two sherries. Overall the bisque was good and the short ribs were delicious and tender. Sadly though, the smelt was limp and not well seasoned and the mushrooms were just okay.

The food here is okay. Maybe better than average (2 stars) but not the delicious tapas restaurant we were hoping for.
author: Amy D.

description:
Ive been here a number of times since we moved to the neighborhood last year. Everything i've ordered has been good and probably the most authentic as far as Spanish food in SF goes. 

Some standout dishes include the Pulpo (octopus), grilled mixed mushrooms, and Callos (old school tripe dish from Madrid). Lots of other great ones as well - most of the menu is delicious, but i've had mixed results with the Paella. Most of the times we've gone its been great, but every so often (i feel like mostly on busy nights) it comes out a bit undercooked. 

Also - service is fine, the wine is good, and prices are not too shabby for this neighborhood and type of food. Its a nice low-key spot to knock back some sangria, have some tapas and relax.
author: Yishian Y.

description:
Pros:
Quickly seated.
Friendly service.
Love the olives.
Snails were a hit! 

Cons:
Crunchy undercooked paella.
Empanada came out like a fingerling sandwich.

Would I come back?  Probably, but only to explore the rest of the menu.  I'll pass on the highly raved paella.
author: Michelle S.

description: I have eaten at a lot of restaurants around the  world and Zarzuelas is by far the best restraunt I have ever eaten at. Zarzuelas has a unique atmosphere. A very hidden away gem. From the street ,the smell of Spain pours through the windows. Cable cars glide down the view from your table. I've been following Zarzuelas since they opened 23 years ago and Owners Lucus and Andy haven't lost their touch. Lucus  is one of the last great chefs of his time. He brings Spain to you at your table. Andy presence on the floor is felt and all his servers are experts of their craft .Arturo,Carlos and Polo love what they do. There is no amature hour here. This guy's move with elegance and make the whole experience special. I'm truly happy to call these people friends. If haven't you tried Zarzuelas ..you have my word as a man ..you're missing out and that my friend is a waste of a opportunity.....Ricky Segura
author: Rick S.

description:
I love tapas!! Tapas with a big group is always fun and yummy, plus you get to try a variety of items.

We came here on a Saturday night with a big group of 8, and got seated within 1.5 hours, which isn't bad considering how small and busy this place is.

We started with a couple sangrias, and then proceeded to ordering a variety of dishes. 
We also ordered a paella for 4 to share, and I loved the flavours they put in the paella. I'd recommend letting it sit for a couple more minutes so the rice soak up more of the juices.

My favourites of the tapas were the pimiento peppers, the shrimp sauteed in garlic and oil, snails with parsley aioli, and the goat cheese with tomato sauce. These are all very simple dishes but they were flavourful, and delicious. I always like it when such simple ingredients can shine so much after they pass through a chef's hands.

Also, we had some vegetarian and pescatarian friends. All their dining needs were met and they were really happy with the selection there is at the restaurant. 

The server had a bit of an attitude but I think it is part of the charm of this place. I really liked it and would come back again anytime just to have some yummy food. Next time I might opt for a wine instead of the sangria though -- it didn't do much for me.
author: Alice C.

description:
I have been meaning to try this tapas place for the last 4 years. And last Saturday the stars were aligned. It was such a great meal!
Started out with half a bottle of Ribera Del Duero-delicious!
Then had the Grilled Squid and Chicken/Ham croquettes-wonderful!
Ended with the Pork Medallions in a cheese sauce and peppers along with the Vermicelli with mixed seafood-amazing!
The other great thing was that it did not break the bank, very good value.
Also, on the weekends they are open till 10:30pm.
Highly recommend!
author: Purva G.

description:
I love tapas and sangria.... 

I think I had really high expectations of this place based on previous reviews and a recommendation from a friend. 

We ordered several things:
Chorizo - yum
Shrimp with garlic - yum
Shisito peppers - yum
Asparagus with goat cheese - barely 1 speck of goat cheese for each asparagus which just tasted steamed and had salt thrown on. This was just ehhhh. 
Mushrooms - yum
Roasted red peppers - ehhh. These were SUPER salty and vinegary.... like the ones that come out of a jar from Trader Joes. 
Vegetable melange - ehhh. Was cold and bland and mushy... all around gross. 
Fried potatoes - yum
Sangria - yum
